description:
## Stoplight Style Guide

Stoplight's built-in style guide contains style and validation rules for OAS (OpenAPI specification) 2 and 3.x. 

This built-in style guide is always initially enabled for Stoplight API projects. 

You can:

- Use the style guide as-is to [automatically lint](https://meta.stoplight.io/docs/platform/7975f76a794c4-validation-and-linting) your API files
- [Disable individual rules](https://meta.stoplight.io/docs/platform/3f80fd36750e3-disable-inherited-rules)  that do not follow your organization's standards
- [Disable the entire style guide](https://meta.stoplight.io/docs/platform/ff8502dfbe156-enable-a-style-guide#disable-a-style-guide)
- [Reuse and customtize rules](https://meta.stoplight.io/docs/platform/2331c5241ddfc) to meet your needs

> For best results, never disable the `oas2-schema` and `oas3-schema` rules. These rules validate the structure of your API document against the OpenAPI specification.

API_Document.description:
The complete API specification document. This can be used to target any part of the OpenAPI document using **field**.

*Use this if you don't find specific targets that cater to your usecase.*

API_Description.description: The top level description in an API document

Operation_Object.description: The complete operation object. Use it in combo with field object.

Operation_Responses.description: Responses for all operations including get, put, post, delete, options, head, patch, trace.

API_Contact.description: The top level description in an API document

API_License.description: The top level description in an API document

All_Markdown.description: All markdown descriptions across the document.

API_Server.description: API hosts defined in the API specification

API_Server_URL.description: API host urls defined in the API specification

Path_Object.description: Path object. Usually used to target the Path key e.g. `/users/{userId}`

API_Document_RecursiveSearch.description:
The complete API specification document. This can be used to target any part of the OpenAPI document using **field**.

*Use this if you don't find specific targets that cater to your usecase.*

All_Example.description: All examples across the API document

All_Enum_Value.description: All enum values throughout the API

no-eval-in-markdown.description:
Markdown descriptions should not contain [`eval()` functions](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/eval), which pose a security risk. 

**Invalid Example**

```json lineNumbers
{  
  "info": {
    ... ,
    ... , 
    "description": "API for users. eval()"

no-script-tags-in-markdown.description:
Markdown descriptions should not contain `script` tags, which pose a security risk. 

**Invalid Example**

```json lineNumbers
{  
  "info": {
    ... ,
    ... , 
    "description": "API for users. <script>alert("You are Hacked");</script>',"
```
no-script-tags-in-markdown.message: Markdown descriptions must not have "<script>" tags.

openapi-tags.message: OpenAPI object should have non-empty "tags" array.

operation-description.message: Operation "description" should be present and non-empty string.

operation-operationId-valid-in-url.message: OperationId should not have characters that are invalid when used in URL.

operation-singular-tag.description: Operation should not have more than a single tag.
operation-singular-tag.message: Operation should not have more than a single tag.

path-declarations-must-exist.description:
Path parameter declarations must not be empty.

**Invalid Example**

`/users/{}`

**Valid Example**

`/users/{userId}`
path-declarations-must-exist.message: Path parameter declarations must not be empty, ex."/given/{}" is invalid.

path-keys-no-trailing-slash.message: Path should not end with slash.

path-not-include-query.message: Path should not include query string.

server-trailing-slash.message: Server URL should not have trailing slash

operation-success-response.message: Operation should have at least one "2xx" or "3xx" response.

operation-parameters.message: Operation parameters are unique and non-repeating.

oas2-schema.description: This Stoplight core rule validates the structure of OpenAPI v2 specification. This rule should never be disabled.

oas3-schema.description: This Stoplight core rule validates the structure of OpenAPI v3.x specification. This rule should never be disabled.

oas3-unused-component.description: A potentially shareable component is not being used. This may be expected, but you should review sharable components to avoid duplicate entry.

operation-operationId-unique.message: Every operation must have unique operationId

oas2-operation-formData-consume-check.message: Operations with "in: formData" parameter must include "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" or "multipart/form-data" in their "consumes" property.

operation-tag-defined.message: Operation tags must be defined in global tags

no-$ref-siblings.description: Property must not be placed among $ref.

oas2-api-schemes.description:
OpenAPI 2 host `schemes` reflect the transfer protocol of the API. Host schemes must be present and an array with one or more of these values: `http`, `https`, `ws`, or `wss`.

**Valid Example**

This example shows that host schemes are `http` and `https`.

```json
{
   "schemes":[
      "http",
      "https"
   ]
}
 
```
oas2-api-schemes.message: OpenAPI host "schemes" must be present and non-empty array

oas2-discriminator.description: Discriminator property must be defined and required
oas2-discriminator.message: Discriminator property must be defined and required

server-not-example.message: Server URL must not point at example.com.

oas2-anyOf.message: anyOf is not available in OpenAPI v2, it was added in OpenAPI v3

oas2-oneOf.message: oneOf is not available in OpenAPI v2, it was added in OpenAPI v3

oas3-examples-value-or-externalValue.message: Examples must have either "value" or "externalValue" field.
